creator: laurent.mascher@free.fr
text:
Configuration:
Windows XP SP2
Apache 2.0.55
ActiveState ActiveTcl 8.4.13.0
websh-3.6.0b4
Microsoft Visual C++ 6.0 SP4

Problem:
 Internal Server Error 500 on all *.html ( access to *.ws3 works )
 Apache error.log file:
[Thu May 18 21:14:23 2006] [error] [client 192.168.0.1] mod_websh - no interp !\n
[Thu May 18 21:14:23 2006] [error] [client 192.168.0.1] couldn't run websh
script: C:/Program Files/Apache Group/Apache2/htdocs/websh/index.html

Solution: 
 In interpool.c line 341: Tcl_Access(id, _S_IREAD) seems to not work ( return -1)
 To make it works, I have done following changes:
 - Define R_OK for WIN32
   #ifdef WIN32
   #define R_OK 4
   #endif
 - Remove the Windows specific code begining line 341

creator: ronnie.brunner@netcetera.ch
text:
Seems to be a problem with this ActiveTcl version.

I fixed the code anyway: referring to a locally defined R_OK makes more sense
than relying on a misued external define...

Thanks for the report.

(Will be fixed in the next release, fix already available in the repository head)
